results.title: A Nation is built
results.brief_description: Frank Hurley (1885-1962) was firmly established by 1925 as Australia’s most famous photographer. His nature portraits became a model for many local filmmakers who tried to emulate his high technical standards and good romantic manner. After filming in many exotic locations, such as Antarctica and Papua New Guinea, Hurley remained in Australia in the 1930’s to become the dominant figure in Australian documentary, making short industrial films for government and private sponsors, such as this film, “A Nation is Built”. Sponsored by the New South Wales government to mark 150 years of white Australian settlement.

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.

results.title: A Naive country kid
results.brief_description:
At 17 Greg joined the air force and his role would be to give the aircraft the best chance of surviving a crash. Two years after joining up, Greg was sent to Thailand and one particular aircraft rescue would change his outlook on life forever.
Called out to an aircraft crash to help the Americans contain a huge fire, the Aussies were unaware where the aircraft had come from. After the flames were put out, Greg would realise this was a Thai plane that he had flown on many times. The memory of this day would stay with him all his life.

results.title: A Musician in the family
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Guy Glover and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The young son of a prairie farmer, against considerable opposition, achieves his ambition—a musical education. Andrew’s father fears that a musician in the family may affect the future of the farm, and tries to discourage the boy’s attachment to his trombone. On Andrew’s side are his mother, his teacher and a neighbour, while the farm animals patiently serve as his rehearsal audience. Perseverance wins him a place among the contestants in the annual provincial music festival, and the encouraging words of the adjudicator help sway his father to acceptance of the boy’s music.

results.title: A Most attractive man
results.creator_credit: Rivka Hartman, Gillian Coote, Australian Film Commission and A Most Attractive Man Productions
results.brief_description: Dorian gets by on his looks, and lives off Frances, a single mother of three kids. He doesn’t contribute much to either her emotional or financial well being. Frances is running out of patience and Dorian’s looks are fading. Described as a “sardonic Australian love story” and made on a $50,000 budget this quirky short film won the Australian Film Institute Jury Award in 1982. Cast includes Carole Skinner, Grigor Taylor, Julie McGregor, Dennis Miller, Anna Volska, Cathy Downes, Anne Tenney, Rivka Hartman.

results.title: A Moon mask by Freda Deising
results.creator_credit: Geoff Voyce, North American Indian Films and B T Film-Sound
results.brief_description: Freda Deising, a Haida Indian of the Eagle clan, is an outstanding artist of the North West Coast. For this film she carves a beautiful moon mask from alder and decorates the mask with abalone.

results.title: A Moomba Magic Moment
results.brief_description: It all started with my promotional photo and my girlfriend Gail Gordon, she entered me into the Moomba Quest, and the rest is history. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: A Mongolian tale
results.creator_credit: Xie Fei, Wellington Fung, Ma Fung Kwok and China Film Co
results.brief_description: This film attractively depicts the harsh life of the Mongolian Steppes, it is a deeply moving film. An old woman lives a lonely traditional life on the beautiful Mongolian Steppes. She and her orphaned granddaughter eke out a living as shepherds. When a fathers asks to leave his little boy with them to be brought up, the old lady acepts gracefully. The children grow up a brither and sister, learning to survive the blistering summers and freezing winters. They cant afford a horse, but as fate would have it, a lost foal wanders into their compound one cold night and becomes the boys proudest possession. The children grow up and become engaged, the young man leaves for the city and an education. Upon his return, his sweetheart has become pregnant to the local bully In Chinese with English subtitles.
